title: Hygiene: What can I do about the bad odor on my feet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tips to practice good feet hygiene  1. Wash your Feet aplenty: For healthy feet it is quite necessary to keep them clean. Wash your feet at the start and the end of the day with lukewarm water. It keeps it clean from the dirt and sweat.  2. Moisturize: The wear and tear borne by your feet each day can result in areas of dry, cracked or scaly skin. Moisturizing too is a must-do for happy feet. Applying moisturizers on the top and bottom of the feet helps them keep soft and prevents them from bad odor, shoe bites, corns and calluses.

Do your feet sweat when you work out? Not work out? Are you a naturally sweating person? If so, they have sprays and powder you can put on your feet to prevent sweat. Sweat usually creates the bacteria or fungus which in turn creates that bad smell. Change your socks frequently and your work out shoes. Might have to invest another pair shoes. Get socks with wool material, that should absorb a good amount of sweat.
